intro: Elaterium glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular elaterium, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Elaterium glandulosum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
